actions.text: Referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.

official_title: A resolution to express the sense of the Senate that the Oregon Option project has the potential to improve intergovernmental service delivery by shifting accountability from compliance to performance results and that the Federal Government should continue in its partnership with the State and local governments of Oregon to fully implement the Oregon Option.

summary.text: Expresses the sense of the Senate that: (1) the Oregon Option project (a proposal in which State and local governments would use strategic planning and performance-based management) has the potential to improve intergovernmental service delivery by shifting accountability from compliance to performance results; and (2) the Federal Government should continue in its partnership with the State and local governments of Oregon to fully implement the Oregon Option.

titles.title: A resolution to express the sense of the Senate that the Oregon Option project has the potential to improve intergovernmental service delivery by shifting accountability from compliance to performance results and that the Federal Government should continue in its partnership with the State and local governments of Oregon to fully implement the Oregon Option.
